intro: Eriogonum pauciflorum var. panguicense, commonly known as the Panguis Valley buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its flowers are usually pink to reddish in color, and it produces small, triangular seeds. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small animals.
